org.simplity.service

Interface ServiceInterface

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractService, JobsManager, Service, TestDt

    public interface ServiceInterface
extends Component
    Defines a Service

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Value executeAsAction(ServiceContext ctx, DbDriver driver, boolean useOwnDriverForTransaction)
      this service is called as a step in another service.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.simplity.kernel.comp.Component

        getComponentType, getQualifiedName, getReady, getSimpleName, validate

    • Method Detail

      • executeAsAction

        Value executeAsAction(ServiceContext ctx,
                      DbDriver driver,
                      boolean useOwnDriverForTransaction)
        this service is called as a step in another service.
        Parameters:
        ctx -
        driver -
        useOwnDriverForTransaction - if true, supplied driver is for read-only. Parent service is not managing transactions, and this service should manage its transaction if needed
        Returns:
        return 0 if this service did not do intended work. positive number if it did its work. This returned value is used as workDone for the action.

      • toBeRunInBackground

        boolean toBeRunInBackground()
        should the service be fired in the background (in a separate thread)?
        Returns:
        true if this service is marked for background execution

      • okToCache

        boolean okToCache()
        can this service instance be cached for performance. Caching, if true, may be subject to further restrictions. refer to ServiceContext.getCachingAttributes
        Returns:
        true if caching is ok, false otherwise

      • getCacheKeyNames

        String[] getCacheKeyNames()
        Returns:
        names of keys on which this service can be cached. Null either if this service is never cached, or it is cched with no keys

      • getDataAccessType

        DbAccessType getDataAccessType()
        Returns:
        data base access required by this service

      • respond

        ServiceData respond(ServiceData inputData,
                    PayloadType payloadType)
        Parameters:
        inputData - input data, possibly a pay-load that came from a client
        payloadType - if this is meant to be communicated back to client
        Returns:
        service data that has response to be sent to client, as well as data meant for client-agent

      • serve

        void serve(ServiceContext ctx)
        execute this service based on the input made available in the context.
        Parameters:
        ctx - any input data requirement of this service is assumed to be already made available here.

      • getInputSpecification

        InputData getInputSpecification()
        what kind of data is expected as input for this service from the client. It is up to the caller (client-agent) to ensure that a valid data is made available in service context before calling this service. Service does not repeat the validations, and hence if the caller has not validated data,it will lead to run-time exceptions
        Returns:
        input data specification. null if this is a sub-service, or a utility service that may accept anything and everything that has come from client

      • getOutputSpecification

        OutputData getOutputSpecification()
        what data need to be sent as response to the client. Service would have ensured that the data elements are available in the service context for the caller to pick them up and prepare a response
        Returns:
        output data specification, or null if everything from context is to be sent back as response.
